userInterface
Class Stats

java.lang.Object
  userInterface.Stats
All Implemented Interfaces:
Renderable
public class Stats
extends java.lang.Object
implements Renderable

This class is the responsible of calculating the frames per second that the GameEngine (or maybe other graphics engine) is offering.

To get the current stats, it's assumed that at the reportStats() method will be invoked only once at the engine loop (may be at the end, or at the beggining).

Once the reportStats() has been called, then a call to render() should be made in order to render the status results.

Method Detail

instantiate

public static Stats instantiate(JannatonTimer timer,
                                long period,
                                long refreshTime,
                                int fpsCountToAverage)
This method provides a Stats instace following the "Single-town" model.

Parameters:
timer - The JannatonTimer to get the time
period - The GameEngine required period
refreshTime - The interval between each reportStats()
fpsCountToAverage - The total amount of resulting frames per second to use in the average calculation.
Returns:
a Stats instance

reportStats

public void reportStats()
This method calculates the frames per second, the average frames per second, and the timing error. In order to get correct results only and just one reportStats() call should be made on each GameEngine loop iteration.

setPeriod

protected void setPeriod(int fps)
This method is used to set the period. It's value will be calculated by passing to the method the GameEngine frames per second.

Parameters:
fps - The required frames per second

setTimer

public void setTimer(JannatonTimer timer)
Sets the timer instance.

Parameters:
timer - A JannatonTimer instance.

setFontColor

public void setFontColor(java.awt.Color color)
Sets the color that the Graphics object wich renders the output will use.

Parameters:
color - The desired Color for the output

render

public void render(java.awt.Graphics g)
Since Stats implements the Renderable interface it can be rendered by the GameEngine, so it's able to render it's result. If the Stats graphics field is null, it will get the Graphics instance passed by parameter in this method.

Specified by:
render in interface Renderable
Parameters:
g - The Graphics instance that Stats will use.
